title: How to Make Cinnamon Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting

steps.headline: Whisk the milk in a large bowl.
Mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in another bowl.
Add the sugar, vanilla extract, and butter once the milk has curdled.
Mix together the contents of both bowls with a whisk or handheld mixer.
Add the dry ingredients a little at a time and mix until no lumps are left.
Fill cupcake liners 2/3 of the way.
Transfer to a cooling rack and let them cool for 5 minutes.
Cream the butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer in a large bowl until it's a lighter color.
Beat in the confectioners sugar slowly in 1/4 batches.
Add the milk, when the frosting gets too thick.
steps.description: Add the vanilla extract and continue mixing on high speed for about 3-7 minutes until the frosting is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Apply the frosting to the tops of each cupcake.

text: Cupcake Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Whisk the milk in a large bowl. Set aside to curdle. Mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in another bowl.  Add the sugar, vanilla extract, and butter once the milk has curdled.  Mix together the contents of both bowls with a whisk or handheld mixer.  Add the dry ingredients a little at a time and mix until no lumps are left.  Fill cupcake liners 2/3 of the way.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Transfer to a cooling rack and let them cool for 5 minutes.  Frosting Cream the butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer in a large bowl until it's a lighter color.  Beat in the confectioners sugar slowly in 1/4 batches.  Add the milk, when the frosting gets too thick. Add the vanilla extract and continue mixing on high speed for about 3-7 minutes until the frosting is light and fluffy. Apply the frosting to the tops of each cupcake.
